sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A true declaration of the bloody proceedings of the men in Maidstone in the county of Kent: who write themselves, John Allen, mayor, Lambert Godfrey, recorder, John Chantler, constable, against John Stubs, William Caton, who by the scornful generation of men are called Quakers. Stubbs, John, 1618?-1674. Caton, William, 1636-1665.
8 p.
Printed for Giles Calvert, and are to be sold at the Black-Spread-Eagle near the West-end of Pauls., London; : 1655.
Signed on A4r: Iohn Stubs, VVilliam Caton. Caption title. Imprint from colophon. Annotation on Thomason copy: "June 18 1655". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
A true declaration of the bloody proceedings of the men in Maidstone in the county of Kent: who write themselves, John Allen, mayor, Lambert Godfrey, recorder, John Chantler, constable, against John Stubs, William Caton, who by the scornful generation of men are called Quakers. Stubbs, John, 1618?-1674. Caton, William, 1636-1665.
8 p.
Printed for Giles Calvert, and are to be sold at the Black-Spread-Eagle near the West-end of Pauls., London; : 1655.
Signed on A4r: Iohn Stubs, VVilliam Caton. Caption title. Imprint from colophon. Annotation on Thomason copy: "June 18 1655". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Giles Calvert
the Black-Spread-Eagle near the West-end of Pauls.
